meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an insurrection.
meanings.sent1: The insurrectional group gathered to protest peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The rebels' insurrectional behavior led to chaos in the city.
meanings.sent3: The insurrectional banner waved proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her insurrectional spirit ignited a revolution within the community.
meanings.sent5: The insurrectional chants echoed through the streets, demanding change.

meanings.sent1: The insurrectional soldiers plotted to overthrow the government.
meanings.sent2: The captured rebels faced charges of insurrectional activities.
meanings.sent3: The insurrectional plot thickened as more people joined the cause.
meanings.sent4: His insurrectional tendencies made him a controversial figure in history.
meanings.sent5: The insurrectional movement gained momentum, challenging the status quo.

meanings.definition: Tending to incite or provoke insurrection.
meanings.sent1: The insurrectional speech roused the crowd to take action.
meanings.sent2: The provocative article had an insurrectional effect on the population.
meanings.sent3: Her insurrectional remarks caused a stir among the listeners.
meanings.sent4: The insurrectional ideas planted seeds of rebellion in the minds of many.
meanings.sent5: The insurrectional propaganda fueled dissent and unrest in the region.
